title: What bicycling across the United States taught me about software engineering
excerpt: The summer between my first and second year of grad school, I rode my bicycle solo across America, from Portland, Maine to Pacific City, Oregon. Having just turned 30, I felt that for a journey like this, it was either now or never. I learned a lot over the course of this trip, about myself and the world around me, and I feel that some of it is applicable to software engineering. This post shares some of this learning.
